intro: Rhynchospora macrochaeta var. quinquespicata, commonly known as the five-rayed beakvetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, three-lobed flowers. The leaves are linear and often have a distinct, hairy texture, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
